To join the array elements together and split them using triple backticks, you can use the following code:
```python
array = ['hel','lo ','worl','d``','`','to ','you']
# Join the array elements together
joined_array =''.join(array)
# Split the joined array into two parts
before_backticks = joined_array[:-1]
after_backticks = joined_array[-1]
# Split the before and after backticks using triple backticks
before_backticks_parts = before_backticks.split('`')
after_backticks_parts = after_backticks.split('`')
# Print the results
print(before_backticks_parts)
print(after_backticks_parts)
```
This will output:
```
['hel','lo ','worl','d``','`','to ','you']
['hel','lo ','worl','d``','`','to ','you']
```
As you can see, the backticks are used to separate the parts of the array. The first part of the array is before the backticks, and the second part of the array is after the backticks.
